intro: Cadetia heterochroma, commonly known as the heterochrome cadetia, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae, which includes many showy, often blue or purple-flowered species. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically range in color from white to pink and occasionally blue. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture. Cadetia heterochroma thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats.
